techniqueDifficultyExplanation: The workout is titled 'Beginner Whole Body Strength,' which implies simple movements suitable for users at the beginner level. The description uses the term 'approachable,' reinforcing that exercises are straightforward with minimal complexity. As it is a bodyweight workout with no equipment, it is likely more aligned with beginner-level movements, though intermediate might apply to users due to potential multi-muscle involvement guided by an expert instructor.
effortDifficultyExplanation: The workout has a short duration of approximately 16 minutes, indicating low energy expenditure. The term 'whole body strength' suggests low-to-medium intensity, ideal for deconditioned users. Considering the workout's beginner focus, the exertion level is predominantly 'Light,' although minimal elements of 'Moderate' effort might be present due to whole body engagement.
requiredFitnessLevelExplanation: Workout type 'strength' is not one of the specialized Hydrow categories (Breathe, Sweat, Drive, Distance). And workout description mentiones it is meant for beginners.
